title: What is inheritance in OOPs?
body:
It is a blueprint or a template for constructing objects. It is used to define a set of properties and methods that will be present in an object belonging to that class.

It is essentially a user-defined data type that encapsulates data (in the form of fields or properties) and behavior (in the form of methods). The fields or properties define the characteristics of the object, while the methods define what the object can do.
